sections.title: Core Platform (GitHub for Buildings)
sections.goal: Complete the building repo system into a fully interactive, version-controlled backend for BIM+Ops.
key_tasks: Finalize arxfile.yaml schema (access control, contracts, share %, licensing status)
Implement diff + merge logic for building data (symbol, floorplan, metadata)
Harden permission logic: protect edit layers, support audit trail
Add commit/PR comments and approvals into logbook/
Write CLI command coverage: arx pull, arx merge, arx rollback, arx share
Add “build health” status flags based on markup quality / completeness
sections.owner: Backend + DevOps lead (Go/CLI), assisted by product manager
success_criteria: Track lifecycle of a building floorplan from commit to rollback
Shares, permissions, and object diffs are auditable
Repo state can be recovered using arx clone

sections.title: Logic Engine (SVG Parser + Behavior Profiles)
sections.goal: Turn smart SVGs into a programmable simulation and markup validation environment.
key_tasks: Expand behavior_profile library for all MEP types
Implement rule engine: auto-checks for power flow, connectivity, spec compliance
Object chaining logic: test upstream/downstream and event propagation
Add logic test framework: mock building scenarios in tests/logic/
Validate object metadata parsing from SVG into JSON objects
sections.owner: Python lead (logic + SVG parsing), supported by QA/test automation
success_criteria: SVGs simulate flow or validate wiring automatically
Logic errors traceable with logs and stacktrace
Behavior profile coverage is 90%+

sections.title: SVG-BIM Markup Layer
sections.goal: Build a scalable, layered SVG interface for MEP markup editing and view-only browsing.
key_tasks: Finalize markup layers (E, LV, FA, N, M, P, S) and color standards
Add layer toggles (HTMX + Tailwind panel)
Implement edit mode gating (permission-aware front-end)
Optimize symbol loading, search, and snapping logic
Implement object “diff overlay” for change review
sections.owner: Frontend engineer (HTMX/Tailwind), working with SVG parser team
success_criteria: All markup layers render, toggle, and snap edits work
Markup versioning and diff views are interactive
Symbols can be added, moved, deleted without breaking logic

Phase 6: Advanced Features (Week 11-12) - Retry, caching, interceptors, performance optimization

sections.title: SDK Phase 6: Advanced Features & Optimizations
sections.goal: Implement advanced SDK features, performance optimizations, and enhanced developer experience tools to complete the SDK generation framework.
key_tasks: Implement retry mechanisms with exponential backoff and circuit breaker patterns
Add intelligent caching with TTL, cache invalidation, and distributed caching support
Create request/response interceptors for logging, authentication, and transformation
Implement middleware support for custom authentication, rate limiting, and error handling
Optimize HTTP clients with connection pooling, keep-alive, and compression
Add performance monitoring with metrics collection and real-time dashboards
Implement request/response compression (gzip, deflate) for bandwidth optimization
Create advanced error handling with detailed error messages and recovery suggestions
Add IDE support with IntelliSense, auto-completion, and debugging tools
Implement hot reloading for development with live code updates
Create development utilities for local testing, mocking, and debugging
Add advanced logging with structured logging and log levels
Implement rate limiting with token bucket and sliding window algorithms
Add request batching and bulk operations for improved performance
Create SDK health checks and self-diagnostic tools
Implement advanced authentication with OAuth2, JWT, and API key rotation
Add request signing and HMAC validation for enhanced security
Create SDK telemetry and usage analytics for insights
Implement feature flags and A/B testing capabilities
Add backward compatibility layers for API versioning
